jade.ui
Class Terminal

java.lang.Object
  jade.ui.Terminal
Direct Known Subclasses:
TermPanel
public abstract class Terminal
extends java.lang.Object

An abstract class that represents a terminal. Features a screen buffer, the ability to save and recall a single screen buffer, and the ability to capture key presses.

Nested Class Summary
static interface Terminal.Camera
          Represents anything which can observe a World.

Field Detail

cameras

protected final java.util.Map<Terminal.Camera,Coord> cameras
The camera registry. Saves registered instance of Camera along with their center position on screen.

ESC

public static final char ESC
The character value of the ESC keyF

See Also:
Constant Field Values

savedBuffer

protected final java.util.Map<Coord,ColoredChar> savedBuffer
The saved buffer. Calls to saveBuffer and recallBuffer use this buffer.

screenBuffer

protected final java.util.Map<Coord,ColoredChar> screenBuffer
The screen buffer. A call to updateScreen will make the screen reflect the contents of this buffer.

Constructor Detail

Terminal

public Terminal()
Constructs a terminal with an empty buffer.

Method Detail

addCamera

public void addCamera(Terminal.Camera camera,
                      Coord screenCenter)
Registers a camera with an associtated screen center. When ever the Terminal is asked to draw the camera, it will place the center of the field of vision for the Camera at this screen center.

Parameters:
camera - the camera being registered
screenCenter - the on screen center of the cameras field of view

bufferCamera

public void bufferCamera(Terminal.Camera camera)
Buffers everything the camera can see, with the center of the field of view for the Camera being placed at the registered on screen center.

Parameters:
camera - the camera which is being buffered

bufferCameras

public void bufferCameras()
Buffers the contents of every registered camera on screen.

bufferChar

public final void bufferChar(Coord pos,
                             char ch,
                             java.awt.Color color)
Buffers a ColoredChar as specified by ch and color at the given position.

Parameters:
pos - the position on screen
ch - the character value to be buffered
color - the color of the character to be buffered

bufferChar

public void bufferChar(Coord pos,
                       ColoredChar ch)
Buffers a ColoredChar at the given position on the screen.

Parameters:
pos - the position on screen
ch - the ColoredChar to be buffered

bufferChar

public final void bufferChar(int x,
                             int y,
                             char ch,
                             java.awt.Color color)
Buffers a ColoredChar as specified by ch and color at (x, y).

Parameters:
x - the x value of the position on screen
y - the y value of the position on screen
ch - the character value to be buffered
color - the color of the character to be buffered

bufferChar

public final void bufferChar(int x,
                             int y,
                             ColoredChar ch)
Buffers a ColoredChar at (x, y).

Parameters:
x - the x value of the position on screen
y - the y value of the position on screen
ch - the ColoredChar to be buffered

bufferRelative

public void bufferRelative(Terminal.Camera camera,
                           Coord pos,
                           ColoredChar ch)
Buffers a ColoredChar relative to a Camera. The ColoredChar will appear on screen where it would if the Camera where seeing it in the World at the specified position.

Parameters:
camera - the Camera relative to which ch is buffered
pos - the position in the World of the Camera which ch is seen
ch - the ColoredChar to buffered

charAt

public ColoredChar charAt(Coord coord)
Returns the contents of the buffer at the given coordinate

Parameters:
coord - the location being queried
Returns:
the contents of the buffer at coord

charAt

public final ColoredChar charAt(int x,
                                int y)
Returns the contents of the buffer at (x, y).

Parameters:
x - the x value of the location being queried
y - the y value of the location being queried
Returns:
the contents of the buffer at (x, y)

clearBuffer

public void clearBuffer()
Clears the contents of the buffer.

exit

public void exit()
An alias for System.exit(0).

getKey

public abstract char getKey()
Returns the next key press, blocking until there is one.

Returns:
the next key press

recallBuffer

public void recallBuffer()
Restores the last saved buffer.

removeCamera

public void removeCamera(Terminal.Camera camera)
Removes a Camera from the Camera register.

Parameters:
camera - the Camera being removed

saveBuffer

public void saveBuffer()
Saves the contents of the buffer for recall.

updateScreen

public abstract void updateScreen()
Updates the screen to reflect the current state of the buffer. Without a call to this method, there is no guarantee that the screen will be updated to reflect the screen buffer.
